description: In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we show why a thrumming US economy isn’t resonating with some key voters.
title: How Swing State ‘Misery’ Might Decide the US Election

description: Donald Trump’s Thursday night speech accepting the Republican Party’s nomination for president attracted a TV audience of 25.4 million viewers across 14 networks, Nielsen said Friday.
title: Trump Acceptance Speech Draws 25.4 Million Viewers, Tops 2020

description: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said the US is preparing new sanctions on Chinese entities that support Russia’s war in Ukraine, and hinted that banks may be in the cross-hairs.
title: US Plans Sanctions Over China’s Russia Aid, Top Biden Aide Says

description: Finance and central bank chiefs from the Group of 20 are on track to issue a consensus document about key economic themes at the end of their meeting in Rio de Janeiro next week, following two years of geopolitical disputes that overshadowed their work and raised questions about the very purpose of the G-20.
title: G-20 Looks Past Ukraine, Gaza to Seek Economic Consensus in Rio

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden and Democrats Have No Easy Path Forward

description: Mexico’s government is preparing a preliminary report with arguments to declare that Vulcan Materials Co.’s Calica mine is located in a “protected natural area,” signaling a potential expropriation of its land.
title: Mexico’s Government Takes Step Toward Classifying Vulcan Mine Location as Protected Area

description: The White House boosted its forecasts for growth and inflation for 2024, while continuing to project outsize budget deficits for coming years.
title: White House Raises US Growth, Inflation Projections for 2024

description: France’s National Assembly reran a vote to elect its new vice presidents Friday after more than the allowed number of ballots was cast, assembly President Yael Braun-Pivet said.
title: France’s Lawmakers Shocked by Irregular Ballot at Session Start

description: Treasuries slipped and the dollar headed for its first weekly gain this month as traders wrapped up an eventful week, with lingering questions surrounding the US presidential campaign and a major global IT outage.
title: Treasuries Slip, Dollar Jumps in Wild Week for Macro Traders

description: Nippon Steel Corp. has hired former US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to help complete a proposed purchase of United States Steel Corp., a deal facing bipartisan opposition from Donald Trump and President Joe Biden.
title: Nippon Steel Hires Pompeo to Help Clinch US Steel Sale

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the months-long, US-led effort to negotiate a cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas militants is close to succeeding, but cautioned there are still some thorny issues to tackle.
title: Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Deal Inside ‘10-Yard Line,’ Blinken Says

description: President Emmanuel Macron’s political group struck a power-sharing deal with center-right lawmakers in France’s National Assembly, the latest indication he may try to cobble together a centrist coalition government that excludes radical parties on the left and right.
title: Macron, Center-Right Join Forces Against Left in Parliament Jobs

description: The Pentagon took its first delivery of an F-35 fighter jet after deciding not to wait any longer for delayed hardware and software upgrades, allowing payments to resume to Lockheed Martin Corp.
title: Lockheed Resumes F-35 Jet Deliveries Despite Software Delays

description: New York State faces a cumulative three-year budget gap of $13.9 billion, a decline of more than $6 billion from Governor Kathy Hochul’s estimate in February, as a stronger national economy and wage growth boosts tax receipts, state Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli said.
title: NY Says Projected Three-Year Budget-Gap Shrinks by $6.2 Billion

description: Democratic donors looking to replace President Joe Biden as their candidate are advocating for an open selection process to find an alternative, a gambit rife with political risks and logistical unknowns.
title: Mike Novogratz Among Donors Pushing for Risky Plan to Replace Biden

description: The risk premium on South Africa’s bonds is too high, a fund manager at Fidelity International Ltd. said, a day after President Cyril Ramaphosa laid out a five-year plan to bolster economic growth.
title: Top Investor Says Risk Premium on South Africa’s Bonds Is Too High

description: A powerful US senator is looking to speed up the lengthy confirmation process to get Christy Goldsmith Romero approved as chair of the troubled Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.
title: Key Senator Seeks Fast Track for Biden’s Nominee to Lead FDIC

description: The Justice Department is fighting the release of an interview recording of Joe Biden cited by a special counsel as proof of his “poor memory,” amid intense scrutiny of the president’s health and demeanor.
title: Biden DOJ Fights Release of Tapes Cited as ‘Poor Memory’ Proof

description: Canada’s housing minister says the government’s efforts to ramp up homebuilding may help bring prices down in some markets, even though that’s not the objective.
title: Building Plan May Put Pressure on Home Prices, Canada Minister Says

description: Estonia’s incoming prime minister, Kristen Michal, sealed a coalition agreement as he unveiled a new defense tax that aims to shore up deterrence to Russia.
title: Estonia’s New Premier Forms Coalition, Ushering in Defense Tax

description: The European Union will discuss a plan from Poland to push back against a disinformation campaign spearheaded by Russia that it says is taking hold in the US and souring transatlantic relations.
title: Poland Pushes for Targeted PR Effort to Improve US View of EU

description: Israel should end its “unlawful” occupation of large parts of the Palestinian territory, the United Nations’ top court said in a legal opinion.
title: Israel’s Occupation in Palestine Is Unlawful, UN Court Says

description: Markets are overlooking odds that next weekend’s election ushers in regime change in Venezuela for the first time in decades, according to Barclays Plc.
title: Bets on Venezuela Transition Emerge Despite Market Skepticism

description: Ben Sasse, the former Republican senator from Nebraska who took over as president of the University of Florida last year, is stepping down.
title: Ex-Senator Sasse Quits University of Florida to Care for Wife

description: Ukraine’s government seeks to increase levies on products ranging from fuel and tobacco to the sale of new vehicles to shore up its ailing budget in what is set to be the country’s first tax hike since Russia’s full-scale invasion over two years ago.
title: Ukraine Moves Toward First Tax Hikes Since Russian Invasion

description: Kenyan President William Ruto began appointing a new cabinet, a week after dismissing most of his administration in the wake of deadly anti-government protests.
title: Kenyan President Begins Appointing Cabinet After Protests

description: More people than ever are vying for one of the most dangerous political posts in Latin America: president of Peru.
title: Peru’s Risky Top Job Is Attracting More Candidates Than Ever

description: Read the conversation between potential Trump National Security Adviser Elbridge Colby and Voternomics hosts as he discusses the possible future of Ukraine and Taiwan.
title: Transcript: How America Will Pivot and Ask Allies to Pay If Trump Wins

description: The Israeli military says that after nine months of fighting Hamas in Gaza, it’s fracturing the group’s tunnel network through mapping and destroying key underground command-and-control centers and arms factories.
title: Israel Sees Major Progress in Destroying Gaza’s Tunnel Network

description: Another week, another gentle turning up of the heat by Group of Seven nations on the fleet of tankers moving Russian petroleum around the world, writes Bloomberg oil strategist Julian Lee.
title: The West’s Squeeze on Russian Tankers Gets Tighter: Oil Strategy

description: The European Union will receive this month the first tranche of profits generated by sanctioned Russian Central Bank assets that are destined to boost Ukraine and its military.
title: Euroclear to Send €1.6 Billion in Russia Assets Profits for Kyiv

description: Zambia’s proposed ban on charging foreign currency in local transactions — punishable with 10-year jail terms — might defeat its own purpose, according to the International Monetary Fund.
title: IMF Says Zambia’s Dedollarization Plan May Be Counterproductive

description: Ukraine detained 30 officials nationwide over alleged embezzlement of funds earmarked for the state’s defense, as Kyiv struggles to assure Western donors that it’s properly using assistance.
title: Ukraine Detains 30 Officials for Embezzlement of Army Funds

description: Nguyen Phu Trong, Vietnam’s Communist Party chief and the country’s most powerful official, has died, according a government statement.
title: Vietnam’s Most Powerful Leader, Party Chief Trong, Dies

description: Meta CEO doesn’t endorse Trump or Biden for president
title: Zuckerberg Calls Trump’s Response to Shooting ‘Badass’

description: Cubans are continuing to travel to Russia to join its war on Ukraine despite attempts by the government in Havana to clamp down on recruitment, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Cubans Are Still Being Recruited by Russia to Fight in Ukraine

description: Giorgia Meloni is starting to find herself shut out of the European conversation. And she’s not going down without a fight.
title: Meloni May Be Losing Her Mojo as EU Relationships Begin to Sour

description: Former President Donald Trump will maintain the trajectory of US-Philippines relations should he return to the White House, Manila’s envoy to Washington said in an interview Friday.
title: Trump to Sustain Strong Ties Between US, Philippines, Manila’s Envoy Says

description: The UK will resume funding to the United Nations Palestinian aid agency, UNRWA, as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s first intervention on the conflict in Gaza since winning a landslide UK election this month.
title: UK Resumes UNRWA Funding as Lammy Urges Israel-Hamas Ceasefire

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin Looks to Trump for a Win in Ukraine

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro canceled his presence at political events until Sunday due to a health condition.
title: Portugal’s Premier Cancels Appearances Due to Health Condition

description: World leaders woke up this week to Donald Trump’s improved chances of retaking the White House, and have kickstarted preparations for what many now see as his inevitable return to power.
title: World Races to Prepare for Deal-Making Trump With Biden on Ropes

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s wife declined to testify in court as part of an investigation into her business dealings.
title: Spanish Premier’s Wife Goes to Court and Declines to Testify

description: As President Joe Biden enters perhaps the most consequential weekend of his five—decade political career, a paradox has come to dominate every discussion in Washington: What happens when an unstoppable force meets an immovable object?
title: Biden Ponders 2024 Fate While Democrats See Exit as Inevitable

description: Taiwan’s Constitutional Court suspended controversial legal changes expanding lawmakers’ powers, putting the brakes on a move critics say is aimed at derailing the new administration of President Lai Ching-te.
title: Taiwan Court Suspends Changes Giving Lawmakers More Power

description: Russian prosecutors have asked a court to hand down an 18-year sentence in a penal colony on espionage charges for Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, the Interfax news service reported.
title: Russian Prosecutors Seek 18-Year Sentence for US Reporter: IFX

description: Is the dollar's reserve currency status an economic burden?
title: Lots More on JD Vance and the Future of the US Dollar

description: Former President Donald Trump has reiterated an openness for Chinese automakers to build cars in the US as a way to boost the economy, signaling a potentially different approach from a Biden administration that has sought to keep out vehicles with links to the country.
title: Trump Welcomes China to Build Cars in US in Departure From Biden

description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he will continue his self-styled “peace mission” despite criticism from the European Union that he overstepped his nation’s role as the holder of the bloc’s rotating presidency.
title: Orban Vows to Continue Ukraine “Peace Mission” After Criticism

description: With a speech at the Republican National Convention that recounted harrowing details of an assassination attempt, Donald Trump basked in a moment that showed his grip on the party to be tighter than ever — and veered into territory Democrats hope is his Achilles heel.
title: Trump Basks In Total Control of GOP as Biden Campaign Hits Low

description: Welcome to Washington Edition. Readers of the Balance of Power newsletter are also receiving this special edition. Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green breaks down Donald Trump’s acceptance speech at the Republican National Convention. To get Washington Edition going forward, sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Finds His Script Too Limiting as He Reaches for Rally Riffs

description: News that incoming Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is tapping his nephew for a top job at the finance ministry has some questioning whether the Southeast Asia’s largest economy is shifting away from its fiscal discipline.
title: Investors Split Over Prabowo Nephew’s Job at Finance Ministry

description: One man has been killed in Tel Aviv by an explosion from a suspected drone on Friday morning.
title: Suspected Drone Explosion Kills One Person in Israel’s Tel Aviv

description: Former President Donald Trump used his nomination speech to take aim at President Joe Biden’s electric vehicle policies, vowing to action against them on his first day in office.
title: Trump Vows Action to End Electric Vehicle ‘Mandate’ on Day One

description: Former President Donald Trump accepted the Republican nomination for president for the third time Thursday after an extraordinary five days in US politics. Here are five key things about the last day of the Republican National Convention:
title: Five Key Takeaways From Trump’s Speech at Republican Convention

description: A 7.4 magnitude earthquake has struck Chile, 45 kilometers (nearly 28 miles) outside San Pedro de Atacama in the country’s northern copper and lithium mining region.
title: Chile Hit by 7.4 Magnitude Quake Near Mining Area

description: Hong Kong’s reputation in Washington is too poor to anticipate any easing of policy pressure, the American Chamber of Commerce in the financial hub said after a visit to the US capital.
title: Hong Kong’s Poor Image in US Means No Policy Shift: AmCham

description: Singapore directed social media platforms to block nearly 100 online accounts of exiled Chinese tycoon Guo Wengui over posts deemed detrimental to the interests of the city-state.
title: Singapore Orders Facebook, X to Block Chinese Tycoon Guo’s Posts

description: Bangladesh is suffering a nationwide internet shutdown as students armed with sticks and hurling stones clash with police in protests against the government that reports said have left at least 25 people dead.
title: Bangladesh Internet Goes Dark as Widening Job Protests Kill 25

description: Donald Trump will call for ending the “discord and division” in American society, while also laying out a conservative vision that vows to deport illegal migrants and restore “law and order,” in his first public address since surviving a failed assassination attempt.
title: Trump Seeks End to ‘Discord’ With Stark Conservative Vision

description: Jon Tester of Montana became the latest Senate Democrat to call on Joe Biden to quit his campaign as fears escalated the president will be unable to defeat Donald Trump in November.
title: Jon Tester Becomes Latest Democrat Urging Biden to Leave Race

description: Serge Pun, one of Myanmar’s richest tycoons, is in the country at accommodation “provided by the relevant authorities and cooperating,” Yoma Strategic Holdings Ltd. said Thursday.
title: Yoma Chairman With Myanmar Authorities, Communication Restricted

description: Joe Biden’s party is gripped in turmoil about whether to force the 81-year-old president aside. Republicans have a clear view: it doesn’t really matter.
title: Republicans Confident of Trump 2024 Win Regardless of Democratic Ticket

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met with a Russian military delegation visiting Pyongyang in sign of deepening security ties as tensions between the two Koreas escalated at their border.
title: Kim Jong Un Meets Russian Military Envoys as Korean Border Tensions Rise
